| Nam Y. Huh/AP Photo Zuckerberg to speak publicly about Cambridge Analytica firestorm

Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg will make public remarks by Thursday morning on “rebuilding trust” amid the ongoing controversy over abuse of the company’s data by the Trump-affiliated firm Cambridge Analytica, a source familiar with the situation said.

“There should be no doubt that Mark was planning on addressing this publicly,” said the source, who added that Zuckerberg hasn’t done so before now — day six of the Cambridge Analytica controversy — “in an effort to fully understand the scope [of the situation] and get to the bottom of things.”
